questions.question: At temperatures of between $0^{\circ}C$ and $-10^{\circ}C$ clouds will consist of:
options: a. entirely water droplets
b. entirely ice crystals
c. mostly water vapour
d. mostly supercooled water droplets and a few ice crystals

questions.question: Turbulent clouds are most serious from the icing standpoint because:
options: a. strong vertical currents mean that a predominance of large supercooled water droplets will be present
b. strong vertical currents mean that a predominance of small supercooled water droplets will be present
c. turbulent clouds indicate a low freezing level
d. turbulent clouds produce hail which sticks to the aircraft

questions.question: Hoar frost forms on an aircraft when:
options: a. the aircraft suddenly enters a cloud at below freezing temperature
b. the aircraft in subzero clear air suddenly enters a colder region
c. the aircraft in subzero clear air suddenly enters a warmer moist region
d. the aircraft suddenly enters a cloud which is at a higher temperature than the surrounding air

questions.question: Most cases of serious piston engine icing occur in cloud, fog, or precipitation with a temperature range between:
options: a. $-10^{\circ}C$ to $+25^{\circ}C$
b. $-18^{\circ}C$ to $+5^{\circ}C$
c. $-10^{\circ}C$ to $0^{\circ}C$
d. $-20^{\circ}C$ to $+15^{\circ}C$

questions.question: Stratus cloud of limited depth at a temperature of $-5^{\circ}c$ will most likely give:
options: a. moderate to heavy rime ice
b. moderate to heavy glaze ice
c. light to moderate rime ice
d. light to moderate glaze ice

questions.question: Clear ice forms as a result of:
options: a. large supercooled water droplets spreading as they freeze
b. ice pellets splattering on the aircraft
c. small supercooled water droplets splashing over the aircraft
d. water vapour freezing to the aircraft

questions.question: Orographic uplift in stable conditions gives a strong vertical component to air movement thus supporting larger supercooled droplets in orographically formed cloud. Consideration should also be given to the fact that in this cloud:
options: a. the $0^{\circ}C$ isotherm will be higher
b. the $0^{\circ}C$ isotherm will be lower
c. the lapse rate will be isothermal
d. an inversion can be anti-cyclonic

questions.question: Which of the following conditions is most favourable for the formation of carburettor icing if the aircraft is descending with glide power set?
options: a. Relative Humidity 25% Ambient Temperature $+25^{\circ}C$
b. Relative Humidity 40% Ambient Temperature $+20^{\circ}C$
c. Relative Humidity 50% Ambient Temperature $-10^{\circ}C$
d. Relative Humidity 30% Ambient Temperature $-5^{\circ}C$

questions.question: Flying in large CU at a temperature of $-20^{\circ}C,$ the amount of each cloud droplet that will freeze on impact with the aircraft will be:
options: a. all the droplet
b. $\frac{1}{2}$ of the droplet
c. $\frac{1}{4}$ of the droplet
d. 20% of the droplet

questions.question: Carburettor icing is unlikely:
options: a. in cloud
b. at temperatures between $-10^{\circ}C$ and $-30^{\circ}C$
c. in clear air
d. when the RH is 40%

questions.question: Flying 50 NM ahead of a warm front out of cloud at 1000 ft in winter, with an ambient temperature of $-8^{\circ}C$, there is a strong risk of:
options: a. hoar frost
b. rime icing and carburettor icing
c. structure damage caused by hail
d. clear ice in the form of rain ice

questions.question: In AS cloud at FL170 and a temperature of $-20^{\circ}C$ the airframe icing most likely to be experienced is:
options: a. moderate clear icing
b. light rime icing
c. hoar frost
d. severe clear icing

questions.question: Mixed (rime and clear) icing is most likely to be encountered:
options: a. in nimbostratus at a temperature of $-10^{\circ}C$
b. in stratocumulus cloud at a temperature of $-20^{\circ}C$
c. in fair weather cumulus at a temperature of $-15^{\circ}C$
d. in towering cumulus at a temperature of $-10^{\circ}C$

questions.question: When considering icing in cloud over high ground compared with icing in other clouds, the effect of orographic lifting is to:
options: a. cause the height of the freezing level to fall and increases the intensity of the icing
b. cause the height of the freezing level to rise and increases the severity of the icing
c. cause the free water content of the cloud to increase and the freezing level to rise so reducing the icing risk
d. increase the temperature inside the cloud due to the release of extra latent heat so reducing the icing risk

questions.question: Kinetic heating will:
options: a. increase the risk of icing if it raises the airframe temperature to just below $0^{\circ}C$
b. increase the risk of icing if it raises the airframe temperature to just above $0^{\circ}C$
c. always increase the risk of airframe icing
d. always decrease the risk of airframe icing
